caption: Fantastic!   GREAT service and awesome pizza!
Delish! Small business, with BIG food! Generous portions of yummy Italian fare! Highly recommend the gnocchi!
The trick is to get your reservations in early, they fill up fast. Service is A+, food is A+++. We had five in our group, everyone tried something different and no one was disappointed.
Great food and pizza!!
We have eaten here many times and the food is always excellent!
So so
"#MUCH_LOVE_AND_MADD_RESPECT_FAMILY."

I’m really disappointed because the food was delicious and it’s in a great location with a great patio. But none of the staff wear masks. Come on, guys. It’s a really simple thing you can do to protect your staff, your patrons, and your community. We want Chicago to stay open, so do your part.
The cheese ravioli was amazing and delicious! I will definitely order again in the future.
Great food and great people. Danny is the man. Their pizza is DELICIOUS as is everything else on the menu. Highly recommended.

Not much to say. For the price, their home made ravioli was  extremely bland. It didn't help that I had to wait by the bar for 20 minutes before the bartender would even say a word. I was there for carryout.  If you're into deserts, they are smaller than expected.

While the thin crusted pizza we ordered for pick-up was delicious, it was very disappointing to see bartender and staff were not wearing masks, and the full bar of construction workers (with no masks), not socially distancing whatsoever.  Poorresponse to
Great neighborhood diner.
Pleasant dining atmosphere with good service and food.
Great pizza in a unique Chicago atmosphere. Walking in you are instantly hit with the smells of warm crust and melted cheese. Well worth it!

Excellent food and service. Was there recently in Chicago. Nice place and very good thin crust pizza, Chicago deep dish pizza normally sux so try their  thin crust. Decent selection of wine and fantastic pasta, great meat sauce. I had meat ravioli- brilliant.
Amazing food. Thin crust pizza was the best and sauce is like my mom’s!

Was recommended that I go here because this place was on TV show. Service was not very good.  And this was not due to them being busy. The young lady who was waiting on us took her time to bring out food and drinks. She was in the kitchen talking and eating most of the time we were there. Pizza was ok at best. Ordered Cheese bread that was amazing but it came out after the pizza that we ordered. Ordered a deep dish pizza. Take usually 40 minutes for those to cook. Apparently cheese bread takes longer.  Would not go back.
This deep dish pizza was the first time I had on my visit in Chicago, this classic is very good at a Triple D joint hosted by the one and only Guy Fieri.

The waitresses and bartenders were extremely rude and not helpful.  They argued with customers, talked bad about them behind their back, gave dirty glares, and even told a customer to their face that they must not get out much. There was a group of about 15 friends eating there and the waitress put every meal and drink that was ordered on one check without asking. Then, they proceeded to tell them there was no way to change it and one person had to pay for the entire bill. The younger group sat there for about 30 minutes figuring out how they were going to pay while the workers sat back, glaring at the group and talking about how dumb they were. The food was good, drinks were overpriced, and I was just dumbfounded at how the employees treated their customers.
Cozy place. We only had drinks but they were made well. Our server was pleasant and came around at the perfect times.
Great pizza and great service
Very good. Reasonable prices too!

With my wife we're visiting the city and we saw this place on a tv Gourmet program where I recommended it, and that S exactly what I'm not going to do, we re an hour before the dinner closing because it's if Web site says it closes eleven of the night and the girl that we met said it was closing in 20Minutes and this was 10: 04 pm, so a very bad experience without trying Menu and our stay is close to the convention center and to get to that place we travel about 30 minutes and they were at nothing... I suggest that you take care of customers that you can make them know in other cities and even countries and clearly I won't

Very disappointed, decided to try after watch Diners Dives and Drive Inns. No flavor, no seasoning. Ordered the Deep Dish with sausage and mushroom, it was a game of find the sausage and mushrooms. This was a swing and a miss by Guy Fieri. Place was empty, no wonder. Very bland pizza.
Love their thin crust pizza
Yum
Stopped in for some food and i have to say this is an amazing spot!
Delicious Italian dishes and great ambiance!
I thought it was good 👍
Hidden gem in the heart of near north side.
Great Food
Worst food ever. Chicken was undercooked.
Food was as good as it looked on Diners Drive-ins and Dives. Owner was friendly and wait staff was attentive.
Excellent Chicago deep dish made fresh, so it takes a while.

Wonderful dinner from start to end. Prices were very reasonable. They even brought out little cookies for my 4 and 5 year old. Waitress was super friendly, and fries were best thing I had, lol. But all the food was very delicious.
1st time there, great minestrone. I had a Italian sub, wow! Casual stop, you'll be surprised.
They definitely met the expectations set by DDD.  Wait staff could be more attentive.
Awesome sausage sandwich.

The food here is good, the price is good, and the people are great. They are certainly under staffed but as soon as they figure out to hire an additional server or two it will be great. Real pleasant atmosphere and a couple TVs on playing sports. We’ll come back here for sure. Good Italian food and the bartender loves talking baseball, go cubs!

Price is pretty good for the area. People are nice and food is good. Nothing to write about but tasty enough to enjoy your meal. Good deals throughout the week. Checked it out for second time since I was in the area but didn't specifically go there for a reason.
My favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago. They make their pasta in house and it never disappoints.  Well worth the trip.

Sitting at Bella Luna on Dearborn and superior  having a drink with friends when we are having a good time on a Friday night, when this lady keeps eyeballing my black friend and then calls the bartender over and tells her that I am disgusting bc I am cussing and being funny. The bartender “Alex” took her side and told me to calm down when she was yelling racial slurs across the bar. on top of all this, we paid to put music on and she lowered it. DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE. AND THEIR FOOD IS CLEARLY COOKED DISGUSTING. AINT NO SEASONING.

Working all around the city In the demolition industry I have tried all types of restaurants and food, I was told to go in there and try a beef sandwich and Let me  tell you It was garbage no taste at all, the bread was soggy and it wasn’t even dipped, I also got a side of fries and that was worse I took a handful of fries and as I’m eating them I feel something in my mouth pull it out and it was a bunch of small copper wires everyone that I was working with lost their appetite they couldn’t believe that was in the fries, sorry never going back
Crispy neapolitan style pizza and good homestyle pasta

Waited 2.5 hours for delivery. When I called to inquire, the guy hung up on me! Don't support this place. There are plenty other good pizza places in Chicago. Delivery guy said, "I can't believe they forgot about you. You ordered hours ago, right?!?!
Good pizza and appetizers
Only 6 people in the restaurant and we waited an hour for our food.   Very disappointed

Can I give this establishment 10 stars please!? ********** Homemade ravioli cooked to perfection...so so tender, meat delicately placed inside to complete this union. Homemade marinara sauce seasoned delicately, so aromatic and delicious, my tastebuds were dancing to the rhythm of the flavor! This sauce is AMAZING!!! Should put it out in the market!  Chicago style deep dish pizza, crispy on the outside and total goodness inside! Do not miss your chance to dine in heaven and be served by a most gracious man Antonio. Awesome, humble man who is attentive to his customers...he makes you feel like part of the family dining together. I thoroughly enjoyed this cafe! It was freezing outside but this place was warm and cozy, atmosphere and company! Fabulous food, fabulous new friend, fabulous visit! Thank you Antonio...and to the chef! Kudos!!

Diff kind of review.. HOWIE IS THE MAN!!!  he is the delivery driver and when I came in for directions he personally drove me home in cold snowy weather and also gave me a lot of great stories the bartenders were very helpful as well but HOWIE pay that man!

More and more, it's getting hard to find a traditional Italian meal, so this is one of the go-to staples for homemade pasta, meatballs, sausage, and sauces. It's a casual neighborhood place that's been around for a long time. Fried artichokes are yummy here too - tastier still if you order garlic bread with cheese. This place is one of my favorite spots for hearty, homestyle food, and a good place to linger over dinner with friends. Prices are reasonable, portions are generous, but not over the top. Service is friendly and helpful.
Burnt Burger. Icead tea tasted like medicine was added to it. Do not eat eat here.
Nothing spectacular, atmosphere was Soo,food was decent.
Had my first chicago deep dish pizza. Excellent! It takes a bit to cook fresh, but quality is worth it.

Stumbled in here looking for food after drinking a lot of high abv stout. It's a friendly little bar that seemed to be mostly full of regulars. Everyone was friendly, the service was fast and the food was good. I'd eat/drink here again.

Good pizza, food, beer and atmosphere, the wait staff could do a better job not reaching over the table, across my plate and food and just going to the other side of the table to get the stuff they need to get. It wasn’t even crowed when we were in there, and

Saw this place on Diners,  Drive Inns & Dives. Good Atmosphere, Nice Friendly Service (expected as I was the only customer) Terrible Ravioli. Shared my feedback with my waitress,  she shared with Danny the owner - he did not care.  $20 for 2 bites of food.
Great food and great service! Nice neighborhood feel. I will be back!
Food good. Service slow.
Amazing food, super friendly staff!
Best. Pizza. Ever
great simple Italian dishes - the authentic ones- and this is being told by an Italian ( an authentic one too)
Absolutely fantastic, also make sure you check out the Family Secrets tour.  This excellent establishment has some interesting history to go right along with that outstanding Italian cuisine.

Wow! Everything is made from scratch and fresh everyday. Homemade dough, sauce, meatballs, and more! So good. And they're about to be featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dive's. You have to check this place out.

I ordered a 7 inch pizza, which was excellent. The place was clean and cozy. Also Alex was definitely one of the best and friendliest servers I've ever had anywhere!  I'm visiting Chicago from out of town this weekend and just happened to walk by and stop in. Ended up being a good choice, and I'll have to eat here again next time I'm in town!
Everything on the menu is amazing including  the pizza which is definitely a good choice
Great service and good pizza
There pizza is great!
Great food and drinks!
This establishment was very clean and the staff was polite & professional!
Decent food, good prices.
Poor quality of eating, boorish owner.
This place used to be a neighborhood spot but I recently visited for lunch and there were only two other patrons...Salad was good for the price.

I had a great time at Bella Luna as part of the Family Secrets Tour. The Pizza  was fantastic and the staff was extremely friendly. We were able to talk to Frank after the tour and he introduced us to Danny, the owner of Bella Luna. After talking with them we learned that this has been a family run business for over 30 years! I will definitely come back to try more of their italian food on the menu.

Only food worse than the Pizza is the calamari. The pizza was burnt and the crust tasted like cardboard - - worse than frozen pizza. The calamari was tough, overcooked and rubbery - - obviously frozen. This place has really gone down hill. Too bad!
Delicious food, lovely music, kind and helpful staff.
Friendly service and great atmosphere!!
Really good thin crust pizza and calamari.  Very friendly service in a casual, quiet place in hectic River North.

Good service from Nedeska but the good stops there. Extremely mediocre food, I live in the neighborhood and I've been wanting to try as I love small non-chain restaurants, but this was a let down. Garlic bread was gross and so greasy, food seemed cheap. The owner/managers or whoever were sitting having a beer. Honestly in an area like river North I don't know how they keep their doors open. Might try them once more and get something else, and will update then.

(Translated by Google) Very bad Italian food the pasta over cooked obviously reheated in microwave. The salads looked like half-cut tomatoes and cucumbers 2 cm thick without any will. I saw the kitchen by chance and it was filthy  (Original) Muy mala comida italiana la pasta sobre cocinada evidentemente recalentada en microondas. Las ensaladas parecían cortadas sin nada de voluntad los tomates a mitades y los pepinos con 2 cm de espesor. Vi la Cocina de casualidad y era una mugre
Absolutely terrible. Filthy tables and glasses. Expired iced tea and coke. Raw burger inside, no not rare, raw! Fries were cooked in old bitter oil. Please save yourself a hospital trip.
Nice, neighborhood place. Not a chain, just authentic Italian food. Usually not too busy to get seated right away.
amazing service and great simple Italian dishes
Danny ,also a very professional atmosphere
Heavenly food!
Lovely! Hands down the best place to have breakfast in the area.
Horrible food, found 2 roaches in my pasta, Server didn't even take it off my bill !!!! I asked for the owner and he told me they weren't his roaches !!!????
Terrible food, strange environment. My burger fell apart and was extremely soggy, fries were soggy, too.
Intimate setting, great happy stafe.
Cozy, friendly staff, delicious homemade food!
Adorable couple.  Been here 30 years.  Personable,  friendly, go the extra for customers.

Great place, perfect for trying out some deep dish pizza when on travel.  Disclosure: I'm no expert on deep dish pizza, and deep dish takes a while to cook (which makes sense, because..physics...)  BUT this was tasty, the manager/owner was awesome and I didn't have to wait in some crazy line.
The pan pizza is WAY better than those "famous" pizza tourist traps.

Let me just start by saying I have lived across the street from Bella Luna Cafe for over 7 years and cannot tell you how great their service is. Mario is the most familiar face when you walk in, and always there to greet you with a smile! The atmosphere is quaint and makes you feel like you are a local (even if you aren't). The food however, is a-ma-zing! Well, the pizza in particular is what we always order. It's a perfect thin crust, and has numerous different flavors that make you want to keep coming back for more! I can't say enough great things about this local gem, except that in the summer time they have a great outdoor patio which is perfect for people watching!
Fun. I had the chicken Caesar salad and a 15 minute conversation with the owner. Both were pretty good.

First things first.  I really enjoy their italian food and coffee.  The wife and I like it for that, and for their quaint, if noisy, atmosphere.  One time there was an incredibly loud birthday party for an Italian fellow and we felt like our food and service was an afterthought.  Anyway, their food is good.  Except for their salads.  Get steamed broccoli instead.  Today we ordered a delivery order from them right when their website started letting us take orders - 3pm.  We put in the order right away, and my wife has to time out her meals as she is pregnant.  So we needed our food within an hour (we live very close).  I called them to check on our food at 4, and the guy laughs, LAUGHS, at me for saying that their website says they start taking orders at 3pm.  He says when his "guy" comes in, sometime after 4, is when they start delivering.  He didn't let me get a word in edgewise, and made it clear that I shouldn't hold my breath for our food.  He didn't address my issue about when the food was going to come.  He just laughed at me.  I didn't cancel the order this time, but I wanted to send a complaint to them.  Since their website doesn't provide an email address, I am posting my grievances publicly.  Just remember that these guys can be sleazeballs.  And get steamed veggies instead of a salad.

Not knowing where to go in Chicago, we drove by and decided to try Bella Luna.  Being the day after Thanksgiving, they were not busy, but that meant that the service for us was exceptional.  Very attentive staff took our order promptly.  We ordered the Calamari for an appetizer and it arrived hot and delicious.  LIghtly battered and very fresh, some of the best I've had.  We also ordered a sausage and cheese, thin crust pizza.  I found it to be very enjoyable and tasty. Not overly spicy, but I added my own Italian spices. It was so good, I ate more than I usually would. I would eat here again the next time I'm in Chicago, the food and service were wonderful!
Bella Luna is an unassuming Italian restaurant on the corner of the street. The food is old school - classic - delicious Italian faire. I highly recommend the seafood pasta!!! SO GOOOOD!
Pretty much the worst pizza I've ever had.
Baaaad italian food
